TextLang.Text: ﺭﺯ ﻂﻐﺿا PS . ﻢﻜﺤﺘﻟا ﺪﻳ ﻝﺎﻤﻌﺘﺳﺎﻟ
ﺐﻠﺼﻟا ﺹﺮﻘﻟا . ﺀﺪﺒﻟا ﻦﻜﻤﻳ ﺎﻟ . ﻩﺩﺎﺠﻳا ﻦﻜﻤﻳ ﺎﻟ ﺢﻴﺤﺼﻟا
. ﺎﻬﺗﺩﺎﻌﺘﺳا ﻢﺘﻴﺳﻭ ﻪﻔﻟﺎﺗ ﺐﻠﺼﻟا ﺹﺮﻘﻟا ﻡﺎﻈﻧ ﺕﺎﻔﻠﻣ
. ﺓﺩﺎﻌﺘﺳﺎﻟا ﺔﻴﻠﻤﻋ ﺀﺎﻨﺛا ﺀﺎﻄﺧ ﺙﺪﺣ . ﻪﺘﺌﻴﻬﺗ ﻢﺘﺗ ﻥا ﺐﺠﻳ ﺐﻠﺼﻟا ﺹﺮﻘﻟا . ﺔﺌﻴﻬﺘﻟا ﺀﺎﻨﺛا ﺎﻬﻓﺬﺣ ﻢﺘﻴﺳ ﺐﻠﺼﻟا ﺹﺮﻘﻟا ﯽﻠﻋ ﺕﺎﻧﺎﻴﺒﻟا ﻞﻛ ؟ ﺔﺌﻴﻬﺘﻟا ﺪﻳﺮﺗ ﻞﻫ
. ﺎﻬﺋﺎﻨﺑ ﺩﺎﻌﻴﺳ ﺐﻠﺼﻟا ﺹﺮﻘﻟا ﺕﺎﻧﺎﻴﺑ ﺓﺪﻋﺎﻗ
... ﺕﺎﻧﺎﻴﺒﻟا ﺓﺪﻋﺎﻗ ﺀﺎﻨﺑ ﺓﺩﺎﻋا . ﻡﺎﻈﻨﻟا ﻞﻴﻐﺸﺗ ﻒﻗﻮﺗ ﺎﻟ
An error occurred during the rebuild operation. The hard disk must be formatted. All data on the hard disk will be deleted during formatting. Do you want to format?
Updating database... Do not turn off the system.
An error has occurred. The hard disk's database will be reconstructed.
The hard disk must be formatted. If you format, all data on the hard disk will be deleted. Do you want to format?
Data for unregistered users was found on the hard disk and has been restored. Data has been restored for the users listed below.
Setting information was corrupted. Settings have been restored to default values and user information has been cleared.
コントローラをUSBケーブルで接続して、(PSボタン)を押してください。
Connect the controller using a USB cable, and then press  (PS button).
Connecter la manette à l'aide d'un câble USB, puis appuyer sur  (touche PS).
Conecte el mando con un cable USB y luego pulse  (botón PS).
Schließen Sie den Controller mit einem USB-Kabel an und drücken Sie dann  (die PS-Taste).
Collegare il controller tramite un cavo USB e premere  (tasto PS).
Verbind de controller bij gebruik van een USB-kabel, en druk op de  (PS-toets).
Ligue o controlador utilizando um cabo USB e, em seguida, prima  (Botão PS).
Подсоедините контроллер при помощи кабеля USB и нажмите  (кнопка PS).
Connect the controller using a USB cable, and then press  (przycisk PS).
Forbind controlleren ved anvendelse af et USB-kabel og derefter tryk på  (PS-tasten).
Koble til kontrolleren med en USB-kabel og trykk deretter på  (PS-knappen).
Anslut kontrollern med en USB-kabel och tryck sedan på  (PS-knappen).
컨트롤러를 USB 케이블로 연결한 후 (PS 버튼)을 눌러 주십시오.
请将控制器连接USB连接线，并按（PS键）。
請使用USB連接線連接控制器，並按下（PS按鈕）。
. ﻡﺎﻈﻨﻟا اﺬﻫ ﯽﻟا ﻝﻮﺧﺪﻠﻟ ﻡﺪﺨﺘﺴﻤﻟا ﻢﺳا ﻞﺧﺩا
Press  to go back, or  to continue.
You can adjust the date and time settings by pressing the %e button. Press  to continue.
Use  and  to adjust the setting value and use  and  to select setting items. Press the %e button to accept your selections.
You can edit the user name by pressing the %e button. Note that you can use a USB keyboard for text entry.
Press the %e button to finish initial setup.
An available HDMI device was detected. Do you want to output video and audio using HDMI?
If you want to use HDMI, check that the input selector on your TV is set to HDMI.
If you format, all data on the hard disk will be deleted. This data cannot be restored. Are you sure you want to continue?
Select a partition setting for the hard disk.
Use All for the PS3™ System
Formatting... Do not turn off the system.
A problem occurred the last time the PS3™ system was used, and the system did not turn off correctly. Do you want to report this problem to Sony Computer Entertainment?
If you want to report this problem to Sony Computer Entertainment, carefully read the following information, and then select [OK].

Sony Computer Entertainment Inc. and its subsidiaries (collectively "SCE") would like to collect a report about the software problem that occurred on your PS3™ system. The report will include information about your use of this system as well as information about your hardware and software. It may also include personal information such as your PlayStation®Network account information, content saved on your PS3™ system and your e-mail address, if this information was being used on your PS3™ system at the time of the problem. The report will only be used by SCE and by the developer of the software that was in use to improve the quality of products and services. You can find more information about how SCE uses your personal information in the Privacy Policy available at the SCE Web site for your region.
The report has been sent. Thank you for your cooperation.
A connection to the network could not be established. The error report about this issue will not be sent.
An error has occurred. The error report about this issue will not be sent.
The system was not turned off properly the last time it was used. Turn off the system in either of the following ways to help avoid data loss or corruption, or damage to the system.
・Touch the power button on the front of this system until the system beeps (for 2 seconds).
Connect storage media at the save destination.
There is not enough free space on the hard disk. At least %1 more free space is needed.
A file with the same name already exists. Do you want to overwrite it?
Press the %e button to save settings.
An error occurred during the copy operation.
An error occurred during the delete operation.
The Memory Stick™ cannot be accessed.
The Memory Stick™ cannot be read.
There is no Memory Stick™ inserted.
The SD Memory Card is locked.
The SD Memory Card cannot be accessed.
The SD Memory Card cannot be read.
There is no SD Memory Card inserted.
The USB device cannot be accessed.
The USB device cannot be read.
There is not enough free space on the hard disk.
The hard disk cannot be accessed.
The Internet connection is disabled. Go to [Settings] > [Network Settings] and enable Internet connection.
A connection to the network could not be established. Go to [Settings] > [Network Settings] and check your settings.
You must sign in to PlayStation®Network.
You must sign up for PlayStation®Network.
An HDMI device error has occurred.
Converts minis video and displays it in higher resolution.
Converts SD resolution video and displays it in HD resolution. This setting can only be used when outputting video to an HD TV.

If the screen remains blank for a long time after starting a game, the TV in use may not be compatible with upscaled video. In this case, eject the disc, restart the system and then set this setting to [Off].
Reduces the roughness of the displayed image.
If you select [Bitstream], some portions of audio from the BD may not be played.
If you select [Bitstream (Direct)], some portions of audio from the BD may not be played.
Sets the playback method of content that is recorded in interlace format. This setting can only be used when video content is output in progressive format.
When video is output through component or D-terminal connectors, DVD-ROMs, as well as copyright-protected DVD-Rs, DVD-RWs or other similar media, will not be upscaled.
When the output resolution is 720p, the screen will be displayed as [Normal].
Sets the playback method for BDs recorded at 24 Hz (frames/second).
Set to always allow an Internet connection or to confirm an Internet connection when playing a BD.
Sets the language displayed for BD menus.
Sets the audio language for BDs.
Sets the subtitle language for BDs.
Sets the language displayed for DVD menus.
Sets the audio language for DVDs.
Sets the subtitle language for DVDs.
Sets the display method (image size) for content recorded in 16:9 when outputting to a 4:3 TV.
Sets the output method for color signals when playing BDs or DVDs.
Sets the output method for colour signals when playing BDs or DVDs.
Makes it easier to hear spoken dialogue at low volume. This setting is used when outputting Dolby audio content in Linear PCM.
Sets whether to output Dolby and DTS audio content in its original format or converted to Linear PCM.
Sets the audio language for content saved on the hard disk.
Sets the subtitle language for content saved on the hard disk.
Sets for sequential playback of multiple content items saved on the hard disk or storage media.
Sets the playback method for content recorded at 50 Hz. This setting is used when playing content saved on the hard disk or storage media.
Sets the codec (file format) and bit rate (data compression ratio) when importing audio CDs to this system.
Sets the amount of time that is crossfaded (overlapped) between music tracks. This setting is used when playing content saved on the hard disk or storage media.
Sets the audio output frequency when playing music content.
Sets the processing method for audio. Set this option according to your preference.
Reduces the difference in volume level between tracks. This setting is used for content that is saved on the hard disk or storage media.
Sets the type of image to display for yourself on the TV screen of the person you are chatting with. To display video from the camera, select [Send Video].
Sets the name for this system. You can use the name to distinguish multiple PS3™ systems on a network.
Sets the language displayed by the system software on this system.
Sets the character code for text used in music and other types of files. In most cases, you do not need to adjust this setting.
Sets the type of dictionary to be used for text entry when using the on-screen keyboard.
Add words to be displayed as options for predictive text entry when using the on-screen keyboard.
Deletes words that were added automatically to the dictionary when using the on-screen keyboard.
Sets whether to notify when Friends are online or when a message has been received from a Friend.
Sets whether to display [What's New] when this system is turned on. This setting is used when the system is connected to the Internet.
Sets whether to automatically start a disc when it is inserted.
Formats the hard disk. All data on the hard disk will be deleted during formatting.
Restores the system software to its default settings.
Formats the hard disk and restores the system software to its default settings.
Sets which system software to use by default when this system is turned on.
Installs other system software on this system.
Displays information such as the system software version, current IP address, MAC address and free space on the hard disk.
Displays copyright information for programs included in the system software.

Downloads content such as game patches, system software update data, and video items we recommend to you, automatically. This system will start automatically at the scheduled time, and will begin the download.

To enable this setting, the system will be reset so that at every startup it will automatically log in as [Users] > [%1], and automatically sign in to your PlayStation®Network account. If you have not saved the password for your PlayStation®Network account, enter the password on the next screen.

Another PS3™ system has [Automatic Download] set to [On] for your PlayStation®Network account. This feature can only be used on one PS3™ system per account. If you set this setting to [On], the other PS3™ system will be reset to [Off].
Do you want to set [Automatic Download] to [On] on this system?
The predictive text dictionary will be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue?
There is no predictive text dictionary.
All terms that were added will be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue?
The term will be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue?
The maximum size of the dictionary has been reached.
[よみ] にはひらがな以外の文字は使用できません。 また、最初の1文字目に「ぁぃぅぇぉっゃゅょゎをんー」は使用できません。
The system and devices connected via HDMI can operate each other.

Although this system is set to operate with other HDMI devices, the system will not turn off with other devices under special conditions such as during gameplay or video playback. For details, refer to the online manual.
Connect to the Internet and perform an authentication procedure to enable use of copyright-protected content on media servers.
To perform this operation, go to [Settings] > [Date and Time Settings] > [Date and Time], and then select [Set via Internet] to set the time and date.
Displays the registration code that is required to play DivX® VOD content.
Registration Code: %1 Visit http://www.divx.com/vod/ for instructions on how to register the code.
Connects to the Internet to perform an authentication procedure to enable playback of ATRAC music content.
The setting could not be completed.
ATRAC is not enabled. Go to [Settings] > [System Settings] and enable ATRAC.
Connects to the Internet to perform an authentication procedure to enable playback of WMA music content.
Windows Media® Audio (WMA) playback has been enabled.
WMA playback is not enabled. Go to [Settings] > [System Settings] and enable WMA playback.
Do you want to format the Memory Stick™?
If you format, all data on the Memory Stick™ will be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue?
Do you want to format the SD Memory Card?
If you format, all data on the SD Memory Card will be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue?
Do you want to format the CompactFlash®?
If you format, all data on the CompactFlash® will be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue?
An error occurred during the format operation.
Do you want to format the hard disk?
Format completed. Press the %e button to restart the system.
Select the hard disk format method.
All data on the hard disk will be erased.

The format operation will be completed in the shortest amount of time, but the least amount of processing will be done. If a specialized tool is used, it may be possible for some deleted data to be restored.
Backs up data saved on the hard disk to storage media, or restores data that has been backed up.
Back up or restore data on the hard disk. Select the operation you want to perform.

Trophies will not be backed up by performing this operation. Do you want to continue?
To back up trophies, go to [Game] > [Trophy Collection] and select [Sync with Server] from the options menu to sync the trophy information for Users listed below.

Do you want to back up data on the hard disk to other storage media?
Restore the backed up data on this PS3™ system. If you restore on a different system some data will not be restored. Limitations may apply when backing up certain copyright-protected content. Refer to the online manual for more information.
Backing up... Do not remove the storage media.
Do you want to restore data that has been backed up? Before restoring, all data on the hard disk will be deleted.
Select the storage media that contains backup data.
Connect storage media that contains the backup data.
This data was backed up from a different PS3™ system. Some data cannot be restored. Refer to the online manual for more information.

Are you sure you want to restore?
The system will restart during the restore operation. Do not turn off the system.
Restoring... Do not turn off the system or remove the storage media.
Restore completed. Press the %e button to restart.
The backup data will be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue?
There is not enough space on the hard disk. At least %1 more space is needed.
The back up operation could not be completed.
The restore operation could not be completed. The system will restart.
There is no backup data. Check that you have connected only the storage media containing the backup data, and then try to restore again.
There is not enough free space. At least %1 more free space is needed.

Transfers data that is saved on one PS3™ system to another PS3™ system. You can use this feature when replacing the PS3™ system that you usually use with another PS3™ system. Even saved data that is copy-protected can be transferred (moved).
You will use this feature to transfer (copy or move) data that is saved on one PS3™ system to the other PS3™ system. Carefully read the following information, and then select [OK].

To transfer the data, you will need an Ethernet cable. With the two PS3™ systems turned off, make a direct connection between the PS3™ systems using the Ethernet cable, and then turn on the systems again.
To prepare for the data transfer, you must first set the PS3™ system to send the data and then set the other PS3™ system to receive the data.
All data that is stored on the PS3™ system that will receive the data will be deleted before the transfer begins.
Before starting the operation, you must update the system software to the latest version.
Saved data that is copy-protected will be moved and other types of data will be copied. When data is moved, it will be deleted from the PS3™ system that originally contained the data.
Limitations may apply to the transfer of certain types of data. Refer to the online manual for more information.
Select the operation you want to perform.
1. Transfer data from this system to the other PS3™ system.
2. Transfer data from the other PS3™ system to this system.

Content items that were purchased from PlayStation®Store have been found. To use these content items on the other PS3™ system, you must first deactivate this system. Do you want to cancel use of [Data Transfer Utility] now and deactivate this system?
To deactivate this system, log in as each of the users listed below, and then select [System Activation] under [PlayStation®Network] > [Account Management].

Trophies cannot be transferred by performing this operation. To use the trophies on the other PS3™ system, you must sync the trophy information on this system with the server before transferring the data. Do you want to cancel use of [Data Transfer Utility] now and sync the trophy information with the server?
To sync the trophy information with the server, log in as each of the users listed below, and then go to [Game] > [Trophy Collection] and select [Sync with Server] from the options menu.

PlayStation®Network accounts have not been created for some users of this system. Copy-protected saved data for these users will not be transferred. Furthermore, these users may no longer be able to earn trophies on the other PS3™ system. Do you want to cancel use of [Data Transfer Utility] now and create PlayStation®Network accounts for these users?
To create PlayStation®Network accounts, log in as each of the users listed below, and then select [PlayStation®Network] > [Sign Up for PlayStation®Network].
Check that you have made a direct connection between the two PS3™ systems using the Ethernet cable and that the other PS3™ system is turned on.
Read the instructions on the next screen, and then switch the TV to display the other PS3™ system's screen.

Waiting to transfer data...
Set the TV to display the other PS3™ system's screen. Then go to [Settings] > [System Settings] > [Data Transfer Utility] and select [2. Transfer data from the other PS3™ system to this system.].
Transferring data... Do not turn off the systems or disconnect the Ethernet cable.
Receiving data... Do not turn off the systems or disconnect the Ethernet cable.

You must first set the PS3™ system that will send the data. From the PS3™ system that will send the data, select [1. Transfer data from this system to the other PS3™ system.] under [Data Transfer Utility].
Before receiving the data, the hard disk of this system will be formatted. All data will be deleted during formatting. Do you want to continue?
After the format operation has completed, this system will restart and begin transferring the data.
An Ethernet cable is not connected, or the other PS3™ system is not turned on.
There is not enough space on the hard disk of the PS3™ system receiving the data. At least %1 more space is needed.
An error occurred during the data transfer operation.
The data transfer operation has been cancelled.

There is no partition for installing this system on the hard disk. If this system must be installed on the hard disk, you will need to create a partition. Go to [Settings] > [System Settings] > [Format Utility] and format the hard disk to create a partition.
Do you want to quit the PS3™ system and start the other system now?
The following installer items were found:
Copying the installer to the hard disk. Do not turn off the system.
Press the %e button to start the installer. The screen will temporarily go blank. Please wait until the installer starts.
Checking for the installer... Please wait.
Go to [Settings] > [System Settings] > [Format Utility] and format the hard disk to create a partition.
Installing... Do not turn off the system.
Install completed. To start another system, go to [Settings] > [System Settings] > [Default System] and set to [Other OS]. Then restart the system.
Do you want to cancel the install operation?
The settings below will be restored:
Are you sure you want to restore settings?
Restoring default settings... Do not turn off the system.
Restore completed. Press the %e button to restart.
An error occurred during the restore operation.

Are you sure you want to restore the PS3™ system?
All settings will be restored and all data on the hard disk will be deleted. If you have purchased content from PlayStation®Store before, deactivate this system by selecting [System Activation] under [PlayStation®Network] > [Account Management] before performing the restore operation.
If you format, all data will be deleted. This data cannot be restored. Are you sure you want to continue?
An error occurred during the restore operation. The hard disk cannot be accessed.

" ", "PlayStation" and "PLAYSTATION" are registered trademarks of Sony Computer Entertainment Inc. Also, "PS3", "PSP" and " " are trademarks of the same company.
" ", "PlayStation" and "PLAYSTATION" are registered trademarks of Sony Computer Entertainment Inc. Also, "PS3", "PSP" and " " are trademarks of the same company.
" ", "PlayStation" and "PLAYSTATION" are registered trademarks of Sony Computer Entertainment Inc. Also, "PS3", "PSP" and " " are trademarks of the same company.

Contains Adobe® Flash® Player software under license from Adobe System Incorporated. Copyright © 1995-2007 Adobe Systems Incorporated. All rights reserved. 新丸ゴ（シンマルゴ）® Rは株式会社モリサワより提供を受けており、この名称は同社の登録商標であり、フォントの著作権も同社に帰属します。

Blue Marble: Clouds Credit: NASA Goddard Space Flight Center Image by Reto Stöckli (land surface, shallow water, clouds). Enhancements by Robert Simmon (ocean color, compositing, 3D globes, animation). Data and technical support: MODIS Land Group; MODIS Science Data Support Team; MODIS Atmosphere Group; MODIS Ocean Group Additional data: USGS EROS Data Center (topography); USGS Terrestrial Remote Sensing Flagstaff Field Center (Antarctica); Defense Meteorological Satellite Program (city lights).
May, Blue Marble Next Generation w/ Topography and Bathymetry Credit: Reto Stockli, NASA Earth Observatory

Copyright 2004-2010 Verance Corporation. Cinavia™ is a Verance Corporation trademark. Protected by U.S. Patent 7,369,677 and worldwide patents issued and pending under license from Verance Corporation. All rights reserved.
Sets for use of a preset combination of elements such as color, background or icons.
Sets for use of a preset combination of elements such as colour, background or icons.
Sets the color of the background and options menu.
Sets the colour of the background and options menu.
Sets the background of the XMB™ screen.
Sets the font displayed on the XMB™ screen.
The theme data will be deleted. The background, icon design and other elements included in the theme will also be cleared. Do you want to continue?
The maximum number of themes that can be installed has been reached. To install this theme, you must delete an existing theme.
There is no wallpaper set. Go to [Photo], open an image, and then select [Set as Wallpaper] from the control panel to save the image.
Sets the date and time for this system. This information can also be set automatically via the Internet.
Sets the order of display for year, month and day.
Sets the time display to either a 12-hour or 24-hour clock.
Sets the time zone to be used as the basis for time settings.
The current date and time could not be obtained.
Sets whether to enable or disable the automatic turn-off feature for this system. If you do not operate the system for a set amount of time, the system will turn off automatically.
Sets whether to enable or disable the automatic turn-off feature for controllers. If you do not use a controller for 10 minutes, it will turn off automatically.
Press the PS button to use a controller that has been turned off.

Although the system auto-off feature is enabled, the system will not turn off automatically under special conditions such as during gameplay or video playback. For details, refer to the online manual.
If you want the system to turn off automatically even under special conditions, select the item below.
Turn Off System Automatically Even Under Special Conditions
Change the number assigned to the controller that is currently in use.
Sets whether to enable or disable the vibration function. This setting will be applied to all controllers that support the vibration function.
Register a BD remote control for use with the PS3™ system.
Register or manage Bluetooth® devices such as headsets, keyboards and mouse devices.
Tests the image from a camera that is connected to the system using a USB cable. You can adjust settings to reduce flickering for some cameras.
Sets the audio input and output devices for voice/video chat and other communication features.
You can change the voice that is input using an audio input device.
Sets the type for a connected keyboard.
Sets the text entry method for a connected keyboard.
かな漢字変換方式を設定します。外付キーボードや画面キーボードに有効な設定です。
Sets the amount of time before a character is repeated when a key is held down. This setting is used only for a connected keyboard.
Sets the speed at which a character is repeated when a key is held down. This setting is used only for a connected keyboard.
Sets the mouse type. Set this option based on which hand you use to operate the mouse.
Sets the speed at which the mouse pointer moves. The mouse pointer is displayed in the Internet browser and in games and other software that support use of a mouse.
Calibrates the magnetic sensor of a motion controller. Use this setting when the motion controller does not control on-screen movement as expected.
The camera in use may not be compatible with the PS3™ system or may be connected to a USB hub that is not compatible with USB 2.0.

The camera in use may be connected to a USB hub that is not compatible with USB 2.0. If picture quality is reduced or the video content is not displayed, use a USB hub that is compatible with USB 2.0 or connect directly to the PS3™ system.
Select the Bluetooth® device to use.
An error occurred during the register operation.
Registration with the selected device will be deleted. Are you sure you want to continue?
Hold the motion controller that you want to calibrate, and then press the %e button.
If the motion controller does not control on-screen movement as expected after a number of attempts to calibrate, try disabling the magnetic sensor by pressing the △ button.
Test before you calibrate the controller. Hold the controller as shown, and then press the %e button.
Move the controller, keeping the sphere lit in green as the central point.
Are you ready to calibrate the controller? To start the calibration, hold the motion controller as shown and then press the %e button.
Do you want to disable the magnetic sensor?
The magnetic sensor is disabled. To allow calibration of the motion controller, the magnetic sensor will be enabled. Do you want to continue?
Displays the status of the printer.
Register a printer to use with this system. Select this option to register a printer if using it with this system for the first time.
Adjust the video output settings for this system. Current Output Resolution: %1
Sets whether to start the screensaver automatically. If you do not operate the system for a set amount of time, the screensaver will be started automatically.
Reduces rainbow-effect artifacts. This setting is used when the system outputs composite signal to a VIDEO IN or SCART connector.
Sets the output format of the color scale for video content. Set this option as necessary for the TV in use.
Sets the output format of the colour scale for video content. Set this option as necessary for the TV in use.

Press the %e button. The screen will be displayed based on this setting. If the setting is not correct, the screen will go blank temporarily. Then, after %1 seconds the system will go back to the previous screen.
Sets the output format of video content recorded in a wide color range. Set this option as necessary for the TV in use.
Sets the output format of video content recorded in a wide colour range. Set this option as necessary for the TV in use.
Outputs Deep Color video signal. If the video output is not clean or the colors do not look right, set this option to [Off].
Outputs Deep Colour video signal. If the video output is not clean or the colours do not look right, set this option to [Off].
Do you want to accept this setting? If you do not press any buttons, the system will automatically go back to the previous setting.
Select the type of connector on your TV.
Do you want to cancel? The settings you have made so far will not be saved if you cancel.
Turn on the connected device. If a blank screen is displayed for more than %1 seconds, turn the PS3™ system off and then turn it on again.
If the screen does not display correctly, change the signal type.

Connector: %1
Press the %e button. The screen will be displayed based on this setting. If the setting is not correct, the screen will go blank temporarily. Then, after %2 seconds the system will go back to the previous screen.

Connector: %1
Do you want to accept this setting? If you do not press any buttons, the system will automatically go back to the previous setting.
If the resolution is not correct, the screen will go blank. After %1 seconds the system will go back to the previous screen.

If you do not press any buttons, the system will automatically go back to the previous setting.
Your TV supports the viewing of 3D content. Select the screen size of your TV for optimal viewing of 3D content in games that support 3D.
Adjust the audio output settings for this system. Select this option when changing audio output devices.
Sets to output audio through multiple connectors simultaneously. Audio output to connectors that are not selected in [Audio Output Settings] is downscaled to 2 Ch.
Sets whether to use key tones on the XMB™ menu.
A connection error with the HDMI device has occurred. Check that the HDMI device is connected correctly and is turned on.
This HDMI device cannot be used for audio output.
Select the connector on the TV or AV amplifier (receiver).
Audio Input Connector / SCART / AV MULTI
Turn on the power of the connected device.
Select the method for setting the output format.
Select an output format supported by the TV or AV amplifier (receiver) in use. The system will automatically adjust the output to match the selected format.
Select the maximum output frequency for Linear PCM.
If the device in use does not support the frequency selected, the speakers may become damaged.
Select the PS3™ system connector to use.
When this setting is enabled, audio that is output to the HDMI OUT connector will be restricted as follows:
When this setting is enabled, audio that is output to the DIGITAL OUT (OPTICAL) connector will be restricted as follows:
Furthermore, audio that is output to connectors other than the HDMI OUT connector is downscaled to 2 Ch.
Furthermore, audio that is output to connectors other than the DIGITAL OUT (OPTICAL) connector is downscaled to 2 Ch.
Linear PCM 7.1 Ch. → Linear PCM 5.1 Ch.
Linear PCM 88.2/96/176.4/192 kHz → Linear PCM 44.1/48 kHz
Dolby TrueHD, Dolby Digital Plus → Dolby Digital 5.1 Ch.
Linear PCM 88.2/176.4 kHz → Linear PCM 44.1/48 kHz
Change the password required to play games or videos, or to use the Internet browser.
Sets the parental control level for BDs with parental control restrictions.
When playing discs that come with parental control restrictions, you can adjust playback according to the age settings selected for this system.
Select an age. The lower the age, the higher the restriction. The highest restriction is for age 0.
Sets the region to be used as the basis for parental control levels.
Sets the parental control level for DVDs with parental control restrictions. The lower the level, the tighter the restriction.
Sets the parental control level for games with parental control restrictions. The lower the level, the tighter the restriction.
The parental control level has been set to [%1].
Restrict Starting a Game with No Parental Control Settings
Restricts the ability to start the Internet browser.
Do you want to change your password to %1?
Register a device (such as a PSP™ system) to be used for remote play with this system. Select this option to register a device for remote play if using it for the first time.
Displays a list of devices registered with this system.
Manually adjust settings for the connection with a PSP™ system. In most cases, you do not need to adjust this setting.
Sets whether to turn on this system automatically when a registered device is connected for remote play.
Select the type of device to register.
The PSP™ system will be registered with the PS3™ system. Connect the PSP™ system using a USB cable, and then select [USB Connection] under [Settings] on the PSP™ system.

The PSP™ system will be registered with the PS3™ system. Connect the PSP™ system using a USB cable, and then select [USB Connection] under [Settings] on the PSP™ system. An access point is required to use remote play.
Enter the following number during device registration for remote play on the mobile phone:
After entering the number, connect the mobile phone to the access point listed below or to the access point to which the PS3™ system is connected.
After entering the number, connect the mobile phone to the access point to which the PS3™ system is connected.
The connected PSP™ system is registered with a different PS3™ system. If you register with this system, registration with the other PS3™ system will be cleared. Do you want to continue?
Register completed. To use remote play, select the connection on the PSP™ system with the name "%1".
Register completed. You can connect a PSP™ system via an access point to use remote play. Create a network connection for the access point on the PSP™ system.
Register completed. To use remote play, start the remote play feature on the mobile phone.
Enter the following number during device registration for remote play on the PC:
After entering the number, connect the PC to the access point listed below or to the access point to which the PS3™ system is connected.
After entering the number, connect the PC to the access point to which the PS3™ system is connected.
Register completed. To use remote play, start the remote play feature on the PC.

Remote play settings will be changed manually. If the settings are changed, the network settings for all PSP™ systems that connect to this PS3™ system for remote play will need to be changed. Are you sure you want to change the settings?
You must change the network settings for the PSP™ system. Go to [Settings] > [Remote Play Settings] on this system, and then select [Register Device].
Enable Remote Start via the Internet
To enable remote start, go to [Settings] > [Remote Play Settings] > [Register Device] and register the PSP™ system with this system.
To enable remote start, you must be set to log in automatically under [Users]. For information on setting this option, refer to the online manual.
To enable remote start via the Internet, you must be set to sign in automatically to PlayStation®Network. For information on setting this option, refer to the online manual.

If remote start via the Internet is enabled, the PS3™ system may turn on unintentionally depending on the type of router in use. (In this case, a remote play connection cannot be established.) To avoid the unintentional powering of the system, remote start via the Internet may be disabled automatically if a remote play connection is not established within a certain amount of time after the system is turned on.
Do you want to enable remote start via the Internet?

If remote start is enabled, the PS3™ system can be turned on automatically when a remote play connection is established. The PS3™ system can also be turned off from a remote play device (such as a PSP™ system). There are restrictions for turning on the PS3™ system via the Internet. For details, refer to the "Remote Start" section of the online manual.
To enable remote start via the Internet, select the item below.
There are no PSP™ systems connected.
The PSP™ system could not be registered. %1 PSP™ systems are already registered with this system. To register this PSP™ system, you must first delete registration with another PSP™ system.

The PSP™ system could not be registered. The maximum number of network connections that can be saved on a PSP™ system has been reached. Go to [Settings] > [Network Settings] and delete a connection on the PSP™ system.
Adjust settings for a device for outputting audio during remote play.
Displays current network settings and the Internet connection status.
Sets whether to connect this system to the Internet. Select this option if you want to temporarily disable the Internet connection.
Sets the method for connecting the system to the Internet. Select this option to connect to a wireless LAN or to change the settings.
Sets the method for connecting the system to the Internet.
Tests the Internet connection and displays the results.
Sets whether to connect to media servers.
Adjust settings for connection to the Internet. If making a wired connection, you must have an Ethernet cable connected.
Set the DHCP host name. In most cases this setting does not need to be changed.
An Ethernet cable is not connected.
Go to [Settings] > [Network Settings] on the PSP™ system and make the same settings.
The value you entered is not valid.
The characters you entered are not valid. Only ASCII characters can be used here.
The characters you entered are not valid. Use one of the following patterns. For hexadecimal: Use 64 characters from the ranges 0-9, a-f, and A-F For ASCII: Use from 8 to 63 characters
If you perform a connection test, the current connection will be terminated and the system will be disconnected. Do you want to continue?
Sets whether to update the system software automatically via Internet when the PS3™ system is turned on.
To reflect the settings, restart the system.
If you use the wrong connector when connected through an AV amplifier (receiver), the amplifier may become damaged.

Do you want to remove the game license?
To perform this operation, go to [Settings] > [Date and Time Settings] > [Date and Time], and select [Set via Internet] to set the time and date.
[★ Debug Settings] > [Network Settings for Debug] is set to [Single Settings]. This setting can be adjusted only when [Network Settings for Debug] is set to [Dual Settings].
Maximum Number of Channels Set on [Sound Settings] > [Audio Output Settings]

To reflect the settings, restart the system. [Connection Settings for Debug (Dual Settings)] will be used for DEV/LAN Connector. You must NOT connect DEV/LAN and Game network (LAN or Wireless) to the same network.
To reflect the settings, restart the system. [Internet Connection Settings] will be used. If you choose [Wired Connection], you can NOT use LAN Connector. Please use DEV/LAN Connector instead.
The information entered is not correct.
This operation is not available here.
There is not enough free space on the hard disk. To install, at least %1 more free space is needed.
Rebuilding data on the hard disk... Do not turn off the system.
Hard disk exchange completed. Press the %e button to restart the system.

Format completed. Replace the hard disk currently installed in this system with the original hard disk, and then select [HDD Exchange Utility] again.
Press the %e button to turn off the system, and then unplug the AC power cord from the electrical outlet. With the original hard disk installed, turn on the system again. For more information, refer to the instruction manual for the PS3™ system.
An error occurred during communication with the server. This is a DNS error.
An error occurred during the install operation.
More than one PSP™ system is connected. Connect only one PSP™ system.
You must perform a PSP™ system software update. For information on update methods, refer to the instructions for the PSP™ system.
To access this content, you must activate this system. Go to [PlayStation®Network] > [Account Management] to activate this system.
A system software update is required. Go to [Settings] > [System Update] and perform the update.
When using a wireless controller, connect the controller using a USB cable.
